edge: The first piece of music heard at the beginning of the movie when young Carl is in the movie theater watching a newsreel about Muntz. The theme echoes through the film when Muntz reappears 70 years later.

Introduced when Ellie is introduced as a little kid and played several times during the film in different versions, such as during the sequence where Carl lifts his house with balloons, which changes from a simple piano melody to a full orchestral arrangement.
Composed the soundtrack for Up, following his previous work on The Incredibles and Ratatouille.
Wanted most importantly out of the music was the emotion, so Giacchino wrote a character theme-based score that producer Jonas Rivera thought enhanced the story.
Each character has a unique theme that changes during a particular moment in the story, as compared to opera by composer Michael Giacchino.

node_2: academy award for best original score
edge: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Score in 2010, marking the first score for a Pixar film to win this award.

node_2: grammy award for best score soundtrack album
edge: Won the Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack Album in 2010.

node_2: golden globe award for best original score
edge: Won the Golden Globe Award for Best Original Score in 2010.

node_2: bafta award for best film music
edge: Won the 2010 BAFTA Award for Best Film Music.
In 2011, the score for Toy Story 3 won the Academy Award for Best Original Score. This makes it the first time a Pixar film's score has won this award.
In 2011, the score for Toy Story 3 received the British Academy Film Award for Best Original Score. This is known as the BAFTA Award.
The score for this context, which refers to a Pixar film, has been recognized with prestigious awards such as the Oscar and BAFTA Award.
